text.0: thou art attached to pressedout soma indra at laud at prayer and when the hymn is chanted.
text.1: or when with yoked bays maghavan thou comest o indra bearing in thine arms the thunder.
text.2: or when on that decisive day thou holpest the presser of the juice at vṛtras slaughter.
text.3: or when thou while the strong one feared undaunted gavest to death indra the daring dasyus.
text.4: let indra drink the pressedout soma helper and mighty guide of him who sings his praises.
text.5: he gives the hero room who pours oblations and treasure even to the lowly singer.
text.6: een humble rites with his bay steeds he visits he wields the bolt drinks soma gives us cattle.
text.7: he makes the valiant rich in store of heroes accepts our praise and hears the singers calling.
text.8: what he hath longed for we have brought to indra who from the days of old hath done us service.
text.9: while soma flows we will sing hymn and laud him so that our prayer may streng then indras vigour.
text.10: thou hast made prayer the means of thine exalting therefore we wait on thee with hymns o indra.
text.11: may we by the pressed soma somadrinker bring thee with sacrifice blissful sweet refreshment.
text.12: mark well our sacrificial cake delighted indra drink soma and the milk commingled.
text.13: here on the sacrificers grass be seated give ample room to thy devoted servant.
text.14: o mighty one be joyful as thou willest let these our sacrifices reach and find thee.
text.15: and may this hymn and these our invocations turn thee whom many men invoke to help us.
text.16: friends when thejuices flow replenish duly your own your bounteous indra with the soma.
text.17: will it not aid him to support us indra spares him who sheds the juice to win his favour.
text.18: while soma flowed thus indra hath been lauded ruler of nobles mid the bharadvājas.
text.19: that indra may become the singers patron and give him wealth in every kind of treasure.
